alert.note: Alert for San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 8:57PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Rain will continue overnight. Current hourly precipitation rates are around 0.2 to 0.3 inches per hour. Creeks and streams in the area have been rising this evening, including Pilarcitos Creek at Half Moon Bay. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, San Mateo, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 200 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 851 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicates rain continuing over the area. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Redwood City, Palo Alto, Santa Cruz, Cupertino, Menlo Park, Saratoga, Los Gatos, Scotts Valley, Half Moon Bay, Capitola, Live Oak, Los Altos Hills, Atherton, Woodside, Boulder Creek, Ben Lomond, Felton, Twin Lakes, Soquel and Opal Cliffs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: San Mateo; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz
